instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-02020: What is 820-02020? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.A2338: What is A2338? A2338 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years Late 2020 M1, Mid 2022 M2 with EMC 8162, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-02020, 820-02773..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02020</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power, PPBUS low
threads.message:
Hello!
Macbook Pro 13 <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2338</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> , Board <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02020</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power, no liquid damaged, like new!

Look on the charger  is 5,2V 0,46A on both ports

<SIGNAL>PPBUS_AON</SIGNAL> is 7,4v

<CHIP>U5200</CHIP> is ok, I've changed it.

Any idea?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02020</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power, PPBUS low
threads.message:
First of all, welcome to the forum!

"<SIGNAL>PPBUS_AON</SIGNAL> is 7,4"
With, or without battery connected?

Do you get <SIGNAL>3V8_AON</SIGNAL>?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02020</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power, PPBUS low
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02020</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power, PPBUS low
threads.message: Please, reply to the first question too.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02020</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power, PPBUS low
threads.message:
Oh! Sorry ))
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_AON</SIGNAL> is 7,4 with and without battery

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02020</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power, PPBUS low
threads.message:
And I have just 8 ohm  on L5800/L5820/L5840 in diode mode
It is <SIGNAL>PP3V8_AON</SIGNAL> rail

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02020</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power, PPBUS low
threads.message:
Remove F5200 and check <CAPACITOR>C5250</CAPACITOR> voltage.

Compare diode mode readings with good board.
Or use reference table:
[URL unfurl="true"]https://openboarddata.org/?a=showboardsolutions&bpath=laptops/apple/<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02020</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>[/URL]

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02020</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power, PPBUS low
threads.message:
Hi!
I've removed the F5200 and voltage is 12,29v on <CAPACITOR>C5250</CAPACITOR>
Also, I have shortage on <SIGNAL>PP3V8_AON</SIGNAL>, 8 ohm in both sides on L5800/L5820/L5840 or <CAPACITOR>C5890</CAPACITOR>/<CAPACITOR>C5891</CAPACITOR>/<CAPACITOR>C5892</CAPACITOR>/<CAPACITOR>C5893</CAPACITOR> and <CAPACITOR>C5894</CAPACITOR>
I had injected 3 volts on <CAPACITOR>C5890</CAPACITOR> and saw that <CHIP>U7700</CHIP> got hotter ...

What do you think ? I must changed the <CHIP>U7700</CHIP>? It is PMIC APL1097

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02020</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power, PPBUS low
threads.message:
You should change it.
Once removed, check if diode mode reading goes high enough.

BTW, PMUs from 14" and 16" M1 are interchangeable.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02020</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power, PPBUS low
threads.message:
Thank you ! I will order it, I don't have.
APL1097 343S00440
